p: Overall, 47 000 men are diagnosed with prostate cancer each year in the UK. 1 Approximately, 4500 of these men this will be diagnosed with de novo synchronous metastatic disease at presentation. 1 As with the USA, where just under 8% present with metastatic disease and where the annual burden is predicted to reach approximately 15 000 cases by 2025, so the prediction for the same magnitude is likely for the UK. 2
